div.p: The Mazharul Uloom College was founded by the Ambur Muslim Educational Society (AMES) in 1969 with the united efforts of a dedicated team under the initiative, support, and guidance of the great leather industrialist and philanthropist Late Janab Anakkar Abdul Shukoor Sahib. The College started with a few students and has now grown over the years like a snowball with increasing number of students and teaching and non-teaching staff members catering to the ever-increasing students population.

It is situated on its own grounds of 21.5 acres along with the newly founded AMES College of Education from the academic year 2003-2004. The College, true to the vision of its founders, caters to learners at large transcending the limits of caste, colour and creed with five UG courses in the Shift I and five UG and two PG Courses in the Shift II.

At Mazharul Uloom College, we are committed to fostering a learning environment that nurtures academic excellence, character development, and holistic growth. Since our inception in 1969, our institution has stood as a beacon of quality education, empowering students to achieve their aspirations and contribute meaningfully to society. The college has been functioning with a noble vision and mission clearly reflecting its social responsibility and commitment to nation building. The institution provides effective and efficient support and facilities to academic mission and maintain a supportive environment for all students and staff.

Mazharul Uloom College, where our mission is to educate, inspire, and empower individuals to become leaders of change. As the General Secretary, I am honored to lead a community where each member is committed to academic excellence and social responsibility. Our curriculum, infused with cutting-edge research and comprehensive training methods, prepares our students not just for professional success but for global citizenship. Join us as we continue to push the boundaries of knowledge and innovation."
